intro: Dipleina umbellata, commonly known as the umbrella bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of blue or purple. The plant features a short, upright stem with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Dipleina umbellata produces clusters of small, clustered flowers at the top of the stem, giving it its common name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is adapted to well-drained soils and full sun.
